title: What is the difference between tuition fees and other fees? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, tuition fees are payments that a student has to pay for their educational needs. Tuition fees are usually determined by various factors that are similar to other fees include: class hours, credit hours, financial aid, admission fee, application fee, and others. Tuition fees also differ from state to state and even from university to university. A student who is interested in obtaining a degree at a certain college should consider some of the basic facts that one should know about tuition fees before applying for a college. Some of the things to consider are: What is the difference between tuition fees and other fees? In order to answer this question, it would be easier if you consider a situation where there is a student who desires to earn a higher education degree. The reason why there is a need to get one's education at a higher degree level is because many employers, not only require people with a high grade point average but also those who have the highest GPA in order to get a job. People who are enrolled in an accredited institution that offers courses on the curriculum are going to be considered by employers as a person who is worthy of their business. What is the difference between tuition fees and other fees? If a student wants to get their education at a higher degree level, they will probably need to pay a certain amount of money. They will most likely want to pay tuition fees but not all students are able to pay this. Usually, people who are paying tuition fees to a school are people who do not have enough money to pay their tuition fees in full each semester.

There are 2–3 type of fee which are being charged from students in order to provide them good and quality services along with their studies. The tuition fee is the charges that are being charged from a student to meet their academic resources, whether it is directly or indirectly linked to their studies. The direct expenses are stationary utilized by the students for completing their studies like question papers, answer sheets, salaries to their teachers etc. The indirect expenses are those which are not directly related to academic of students like electricity charges, class room maintenance etc. There are other types of fees which an applicant have to bear like: Examination Fee - This is the fee which are charges annually or semester wise depending on colleges and universities policies, so that candidate can appear for the exams. It includes the salaries of examiners, and other resources which are utilized at the time of exam.Hostel Fee - These are the residential charges that student have to bear for living in the University’s residential facility. It might or might not include the food or mess charges depending from colleges.Laundry Charges - It is the laundry charges that applicant has to pay for their clothes.Compounding Fee - It is a fee that is imposed on the students against any mislead or delay in submitting their fee.Hope you get the answer to your query.
